I assume if I have a mastectomy with implant reconstruction that they will take the old ones out and put new ones in? Thanks! Posts.Title: Anyone Have Implants prior to Diagnosis? yasminv1 danix5

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2009 01:52PM - edited Sep 13, 2009 01:53PM by yasminv1 Tabatha - I am doing Taxotere and have a rash from it on my head, face and armpit. The rash (2 hard acne looking little lumps) appeared under my right armpit on Friday morning (8 days after my second tx). My onc suspected I had Shingles but when I saw him that afternnoon he confirmed I had infected follicles. Not sure how the rash in other places isn't bad but it is under my armpit. I haven't shaved in weeks since I lost under arm hair from chemo. My onc gave me a prescription for an antibiotic but asked me not to fill it unless the rash spreads. He also recommended warm moist compresses 4 times a day. The lumps are painful and have started to get bigger as they look like they are becoming one. It hurts constantly so I can't really use my arm all that much right now. I am going to give it one more day and if I see no improvement tomorrow I will call my Onc and see if I need to start on these antibiotics. Please call you Onc. It's probably just a rash but you want to get checked out just in case.
Posts.Title: FREAKING OUT (but trying not to) Tabatha00 yasminv1

Posts.Content: May 22, 2009 05:17AM yasminv1 wrote: Alicia, I know exactly what you mean. I too am sick of doctors and appointments. It is an inconvenience. Even with insurance, the bills just keep coming and I am graced with being able to pay the coinsurance. Good Luck with Surgery on Wed. I wish you the best and hope you have a quick and smooth recovery. I am scheduled for surgery on June 15th. Due to the large area of DCIS in my small left breast as well as the location of it, mastectomy was really the only option for me. After many sleepless nights and doing tons of research I decided last week that I would have a bilateral mastectomy. They biopsied an area on my right breast and determined it was benign, but they wanted to "watch" it and want to take a look at it in 6 months. For me, my young age, as well as more biopsies, annual testing, fear of BC occurring on the healthy was just too overwhelming to think about. I have a little bit of anxiety here and there thinking about what that final pathologist report is going to say after they test all of my breast tissue. I pray they do indeed just find pure DCIS on the left breast and hopefully nothing on my right breast. The past few weeks six weeks since diagnosis have been a blur. It will be a long year since I will be having immediate reconstruction with tissue expanders and implants. In the end though I will be happy to hopefully be cured and move on with my life. Yasmin
Posts.Title: DCIS lynniejojo lynniejojo

Posts.Content: yasminv1 wrote: How significant is information published on BC Studies? I came across this study published 11/2009 and it disturbed me but also made me question its validity. I was diagnosed with mutilfocal & Multi-Cancer-Type Early BC last year. I did mastectomy, chemo and now on tamox. My Oncologist and Breast Surgeon say I have a good prognosis because all tumors were Stage I and small. But this study contradicts that and I know talking to my Oncologist he will likely tell me to ignore this as he has told me about other studies in the past. I don't live day to day thinking I am going to die from BC, but I can't help but get disturbed when I come across studies like this. I also know that in terms of treatment all that could be done has been done. I feel like a paranoid freak! Are studies just something I need to ignore? http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19907646 Link to complete Research Article: http://www.plosone.org/article/info:doi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0007695 Dx 4/8/2009, Bilateral Mastectomy 6/15/09,DCIS 5CM and IDC, 5.5mm and 3mm, Stage Ib, Grade 1, Mucinous Carcinoma 2mm, Stage 1, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2-,TCx4 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Significance Of Studies??? yasminv1 yasminv1

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2009 01:57PM yasminv1 wrote: Hi, I am sorry you had to join our group. I had extensive DCIS (5cm) with IDC in the upper inner quadrant of my left breast. Depending on how large the cancer is depends on whether you can have good cosmetic results with a lumpectomy. Due to the large area of cancer I had and since it was Multifocal and I had little breast tissue, my breast surgeon said a mastectomy was best for me. He felt a lumpectomy would leave me looking disfigured. BS had to take tissue clear up to my collarbone. I would suggest asking a breast surgeon and plastic surgeon how much breast tissue needs to be taken and what you might look like after surgery. I have no idea on how to deal with HMOs. Hopefully someone will help. Maybe post on the Help me through treatment forum asking those with HMOs for help? Good Luck!
Posts.Title: strange dcis location? crvzzz yasminv1

Posts.Content: May 7, 2009 12:59PM yasminv1 wrote: No other symptoms for me as far as I know. I felt a lump in the top center portion of my left breast. No pain. I watched it for a couple months to see if it changed. I thought being only 30 yrs old it could not be BC and no one in my family has had BC. Finally went and had my OBGYN look at it. She too thought it would not be BC. Mammogram and Ultrasound showed 2 lumps and calcifications.
Posts.Title: OTHER SYMPTOMS??? ameron zuzeee

Posts.Content: yasminv1 wrote: Help! I am hoping you ladies can possibly give me some advice. I am 31 yrs old and I am struggling with deciding whether to go through 4 cycles of AC or not. My cancer was caught early but the Oncotype DX test put me in the Intermediate risk, score 18. My age which indicates I am high risk and this intermediate risk from the Oncotype test is really the driver in chemo not being off the plate for me. My Doc has left the decision up to me. He said it is not unreasonable for me to decide on no chemo but also not unreasonable to have chemo either. The information out there is not sufficient to say whether chemo will be of benefit to me but it also cannot tell me if Tamoxifen alone will be sufficient. Studies have shown that women 35 years old and younger have a higher rate of cancer returning than older women diagnosed with the same stage. Studies also show that cancer in women under 35 is biologically more aggressive. I am torn and scared especially since my Oncologist cannot tell me that the risks of chemo outweigh the risks of my cancer returning. I've considered a second opinion but like my Oncologist mentioned another doctor is not going to be able to help make my decision because the data out there for people my age is not sufficient. A family member on my husband's side just finished chemo last month for BC. Her score was 15 and she is in her late 40's. Her doctor told her he recommends chemo for all patients that receive an Oncotype Score of 11 and above. Dx 4/8/2009, Bilateral Mastectomy 6/15/09,DCIS 5CM and IDC, 5.5mm and 3mm, Stage Ib, Grade 1, Mucinous Carcinoma 2mm, Stage 1, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2-,TCx4 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 31 yrs. Old Struggling to decide on Chemo yasminv1 yasminv1

Posts.Title: Heidi Update-it isn't pretty Heidi_Ho zeeka71

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2009 12:35PM yasminv1 wrote: Hi Everyone. What a wonderful thread. It has definitely helped reduce some of my pre tx anxiety. I will be starting TC X 4 this Thursday 8/13. Due to my age 31 and oncotype dx of 18 I have decided to go through with chemo. I was told initially that I would have AC but my Oncologist said it was a mistake and now I am having TC. I am nervous about tx but I am trying to stay positive. Hopefully, I will have little side effects. I am not as nervous about losing my hair as I am about what it will look like when it comes back. I have talked to some BC survivors that have had regrowth with different hair texture and some with straight hair have curly hair now. Oh well.. I guess we'll see. My Oncologist did not give me any prescriptions to take before tx this Thursday. Is this normal? He said I would be given Emend the day of tx. Also, how much exercise have you been able to do during tx. I am wondering if I will be able to keep up with my current workout program. I typically lift weight 3 days a week and do moderate cardio 4-5 days a week. Best wishes to all.
Posts.Title: TC X 4 Solarbeam Solarbeam
